ja79:1.1: A village headman conspires with bandits to leave a village helpless and ripe for the plunder.
ja79:1.3: _Āgamā_ is aorist singular. | See the nearly identical phrase at [mn76:53.5](); here we have _puttahatāya_ rather than _puttamatāya_, but both mean the same thing.
ja79:1.4: Typically the expression _kharassara_ is used for the beating of a drum to announce an execution ([sn12.70:28.5]()).
